website_summaries.verdict: May not be as large as advertised, but it does offer users a number of different locking options to control pet traffic. We appreciate its entry-level price point and additional features. A great bargain!
pros: This pet door is the ideal size for most cats, but small enough to discourage outsiders
Brush liner grooms cats and reduces drafts
cons: Locking mechanism has durability issues and can be difficult to operate
Magnet and spring may be too strong for smaller cats

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on a hollow core interior door in 30 minutes and I'm home improvement challenged. Took the door off the hinges, brought it outside where I used the template (that has a sticky edge to keep it in place!), traced it, drilled some pilot holes and used a jig saw to cut it out. Everything snapped in nicely and secured properly with the provided screws and caps.
customer_reviews.author: TOM-O

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cat door. Exactly what we wanted. One minor modification necessary.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect cat door with one minor modification needed. After training the cats to use it into and out of the basement door, they love it. It's now a fun game. Only modification needed was to the clips that lock the door from one or both sides. When the cats get crazy and sprint through it full speed, they somehow catch the locks while jumping through... locking them into or out of the basement. Solution: force a piece of tooth pick in between the locks to keep them pushed apart in unlocked position.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by four cats and two hoomans.
customer_reviews.text: I asked me cats to review this after having it for most of a year... then said: Morris: Meow, nuzzle. Meow. Seka: <stayed quite but seems to approve> Pepper: Well sir, I believe the first four times I used this contraption, it could have gone better. Also the "getting caught and freaking out episodes", as you so put it, could have gone better. Overall I rather enjoy this funny door device you put on the basement door. Good day sir, I need to go lay in the sun now. Runt: BARK BARK BARK... I'm a donkey!!! BARK BARK. <This is actually a cat, but he's confused> They like it, I like the saved air-flow and heating bills.... nice stuff!
customer_reviews.author: bigfooty

customer_reviews.title: Extremely pleased
customer_reviews.text: It works great. The only issues were of my own doing. My door is home made and thicker than this was made for but even so it was a breeze to install. I would say I had it out of the box and installed in 30 minutes. I propped the door open so the cat would get used to coming through the hole before using the door. Once I started using the door the cat was a little undecided so I pushed him through from both sides a couple of times. After that he used it on his own. Now he comes and goes as he pleases without pestering me to constantly open and close the door. Fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: A real energy saver.
customer_reviews.text: Took a couple of days for the cats to learn how to use the door, but now I can close the door to the sunroom and keep the heat (later this year, the cold) from leaving the main part of the house. Now the 3 house cats can go in and out to the sunroom on their own. I don't have to make sure they are able to get to the litter box or keep jumping up to open the door to the sunroom because they are scratching at it to go in or out.
customer_reviews.author: Helen H.

customer_reviews.title: Great door.
customer_reviews.text: I have three cats. They all use the door almost instinctively. You can make the door swing two-way (enter and exit, like normal), 1-way enter, or 1-way exit. I like that feature a lot and have used it to trap cats inside or outside (when I got a new cat I trapped the bully outside when I was away from the house). I don't quite understand how the 4 mechanical slide switches work to accomplish these three settings (and I rarely read instructions), but I fiddle with the slide switches until I achieve the correct result. Also, my cat is huge (21 lbs) and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: jwd

customer_reviews.title: Love it except for one thing...
customer_reviews.text: Loved the magnetic door and the ability to lock or unlock it as needed. The only thing I dislike is the fact that one of my cats will continuously 'paw' at it before she walks through it and most of the time she knocks it completely out. It's aggravating because this is on the door that leads to the steps to our basement where their litter box and food is located so sometimes I have to go up and down the steps continuously to get the door and put it back in. I wish (although I plan to find) there was a way to permanently affix it to the door so it doesn't keep coming out.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy B

customer_reviews.title: meets and exceeded all expectations
customer_reviews.text: I didnt expect much from this door flap since I bought a similar one a while back, but this unit has everything the other one was missing. If you're worried about having all the parts for the install, worry no more. they include EVERYTHING with this unit. All the machine screws, a "telescoping" center part thats easy to cut-to-fit, clear and legible instructions, and a cutting template so I didnt have to make my own. the product itself also feels great quality for the price. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dan D.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: This cat door worked perfectly. We are full time rv'ers and used this door to make an entrance for the underbelly of our fifth wheel for litter box and nocturnal activities. Works great. Our cats are brutes and I was concerned about the plastic latches holding up against them (because we lock them in the play area at night so we can sleep and they can play.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Clark

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, good price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice cat door with a pretty clean finish after it's installed. Installation was simple. The magnet may be a bit overpowered for some cats. There are two magnets, one is inside a piece of plastic on the flap itself and another just below it on the frame. Neither are going to be easy to remove. The only way I was able to remove the magnet on the frame was to drill a small hole from the front of the frame behind the magnet and lightly hammer it out with a nail countersink. It's epoxied on there pretty good. Since the magnet has been removed my cat has now started to use the door on her own.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware: Cat can open locked door!
customer_reviews.text: In one night my cat figured out how to unlock the locked kitty door. I have tried extra methods to keep him locked in, but he ends up breaking the little door off! Great hole in my door now, so glad it's easy for him to go in and out, but when I want him to stay out, say at 3am when he thinks it's time to talk my ear off, he can easily unlock the door himself in a matter of minutes now. Maybe your cat is dumb? I don't know this whole thing feel cheaply made, wouldn't buy.
customer_reviews.author: KaraBee

customer_reviews.title: Instructions for installing were excellent. I installed it on a hollow core door ...
customer_reviews.text: Instructions for installing were excellent. I installed it on a hollow core door without any problems. Just be certain that you don't over tighten the screws so you don't strip the holes. I used a much smaller drill bit for the pilot holes to avoid possibly stripping the holes. One of my cats will not go through a swinging door flap. It is nice that the door flap can be removed easily and have to be taped or otherwise propped open. This door is an excellent value for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Blancstare

customer_reviews.title: Great cat door, but doesn't hold up to weather
customer_reviews.text: I really like this door, but had to take a star off because the locks wear out quickly, perhaps more so due to weathering on an exterior door. It's plastic wears down on the locks, & eventually they don't work right.. either locking your cat in or worse, locking her out by accident! However, I still am giving it 4 stars because I can't find another one like this specifically for large cats, and my Gracy is a big girl! I just have to buy a new one every couple of years ... and they are cheap enough to do that!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little loud for interior door but with it.
customer_reviews.text: Durable good product. I was enlarging the one that was in our home when we moved in as we have longer bigger cats. Install went okay. Template was alright. I used a marker and traced around. The door itself is good for locking different ways which I like. Not used for and exterior door but if we need the cats to stay in the basement for a project, we can. Door was hard for the cats to get comfortable going in and out of bc it has a good spring to move things back to the center. Door is a little loud but it kind of helps us know when they come and go. Overall impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well - indoor installation
customer_reviews.text: I installed it for my mother in law's cat. It could go in between the kitchen and laundry room without the door having to be open. Pros: * Easy install * large enough for the cat * not large enough for the dog that likes to eat the cat's food Cons: * the tabs at the bottom that control which way the door can swing move around pretty easy. Too easy.
customer_reviews.author: I Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Great cat door for extra large kitty friends
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 cats, one very fat cat (17 or so lbs), and the other normal size (9lbs). They are both able to use this door easily. We lock them downstairs at night due to their lovely tendency to wake up the entire house in the middle of the night. Thankful it has locks on both sides because we started out using only one side and somehow my braniacs got it open. Haven't had any issues since we started using both locks.
customer_reviews.author: SpeedyChk3

customer_reviews.title: Improper installation instructions/wrong hardware
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this twice now, and I apparently forgot the pain it was to install. The instructions say to drill 3/16" holes for the corner screws but the screws provided are not sized for a 3/16" hole. Then they want you to put 2 screws in the same hole from either side, you'd need some pretty precise measurements to achieve proper installation like that. The door works but get creative when you're installing it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill P.

customer_reviews.title: Just right for our big 15 lb cat.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice product. To use it on an interior door, I replaced the paneled door with a flat slab interior door. Then we can always change the door back to the original once we no longer need it. The magnet is a bit too strong for an indoor application. Took a couple of tries with treats for the bigger cat to learn. He doesn't like that it snaps down on his tail. Just the right size for our 15 lb cat. Our 13 lb cat never figured it out. So we would probably have to remove the flap for her to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works, kind of
customer_reviews.text: Well, first off...the product does its job. My main complaint is that one of the lock mechanisms was sticking on the cat door, which didn't allow my cat to come back in from the catio. I ended up having to use plyers to rip the locking latch off, so the door wouldn't stick. It was frustrating. Once I had installed it in the wall, it was far too late to return the product. It works now, but it just doesn't lock. Keep that in mind when you are purchasing this cat door.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Polk

customer_reviews.title: Great cat door!
customer_reviews.text: We have one of the cat doors in our current house, and have had one installed in our soon-to-be residence. The door works very well for us and for the cats. The 3-way locking is great, and very easy to use. I can't comment on the installation. My husband and I are handy-impaired, and always have a handyperson do the installation. The door works beautifully for our small cat as well as our 19-lb Maine Coon.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Good Cat Door
customer_reviews.text: I had someone to help me install it so it wasn't hard for me. lol. I bought the large one, I have two one year old cats, they can go through it fine. But I wouldn't go any smaller. It's good because it blocks whatever the smell cats create down the basement. It's kind of tight. I had to show my cats that this door can be open and closed from both sides. They freaked out about it for a little bit, then they started to use it just fine. They like it, I like it, so it's great. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: H. He

customer_reviews.title: Good door, but magnet is too strong
customer_reviews.text: The door seems good quality and the install was pretty easy. The only thing I don't like is the magnet that holds it closed is way too strong. Our cats have not been able to open it without help, we have to leave the door propped open all the time. I'm sure with more forceful training they could probably get it, but its too strong to be obvious to them that the door can move. And there's no easy way to remove the magnet without breaking the plastic around it.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Not safe if you have a baby or toddler
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6 month old male cat who is abnormally large and I figure will get larger with age. However I have a 17 month old toddler (who is 32” tall and weighs 30 lbs) and yeah she can go through it unfortunately. We need it for our basement door so this just is not going to work for us. Perhaps when we no longer have babies we can upgrade to this larger one but i will have to order something smaller this is getting returned. It seems to be a decent cat door though I’m weary of the bristle barrier it doesn’t seem like something that would last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Tamer10

customer_reviews.title: Really good value
customer_reviews.text: As good as the more expensive kitty doors we have had. A bit smaller than advertised, and the template that comes with it works, but the hole you cut is WAY BIGGER than necessary. I stuffed our door with a bit of insulation where the hole was too big. It does make a noise when the kitties go through, but I like that. Locking works alright...not a big feature for us.
customer_reviews.author: flounderguts

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: My 25 lb cat needed a door this size. I removed two stars because the magnet is way too strong. The cats (we have 5) have to really push hard to get it to open. One cat took a month of us shoving him through it to realize he could make it open himself. A kitten would not be able to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The hole you cut is too close to where the screws must be screwed in, and that makes for less than desirable installation. The flap is also a little more difficult for my cats to nudge through than the last one we had. Out of 4 cats, only one will use this cat door.
customer_reviews.author: MCD

customer_reviews.title: Drill size in instructions is wrong, but other then that its good
customer_reviews.text: Be careful when your drilling the screw holes. The drill bit size they recommend is bigger then the screws they provide. For that reason i had to doc a star. Made a 15 min job take 3x as long because i had to figure out a solution since you only can cut the hole once. Ultimately i found a dry wall anchor that worked with the screws provided and that worked well enough to keep it in place. Now that its in it works great and the cat picked it up within a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: Random

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm and all our large cats fit with ease.
customer_reviews.text: This was the 2nd cat door I have purchased. The first was "Ideal Pet Products 6.25-by-6.25-Inch Lockable Cat Flap with Telescoping Frame" and I wish I had purchased that one again. This unit isn't bad and works as expected. The install is easy enough it just lacks a template that was actual size. The one mine came with was slightly smaller and I had to drawl/cut out my own for the best fit. I would recommend making your own template and taking the door off for cutting/installing. Also note the regular metal blade for the jigsaw isn't long enough to go through both sides of a normal exterior door.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Zelski

customer_reviews.title: Large enough for my 20 lb Maine Coon Cat
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about ordering this door for fear that it wouldn't be large enough for my 20 lb.Maine Coon cat. But.....no worries, he charges in and out of it at will and even seems to like having his own little exit and entrance! He even has room to carry things in his mouth (mice) from the basement! Ugh! Well, anyways, I promise you that this door is big enough for your cat unless you have a record holding size cat! Just make sure you get the "Cat Mate Large Cat Door".
customer_reviews.author: Linda J

customer_reviews.title: Versatile with easy installation.
customer_reviews.text: Love the versatility to select which way the pets can go through the door. It is also adjustable to fit a wide range of wall thicknesses. We installed this on our fence, which is only a half inch thick. It was easy to install and works great. The only thing I don't like about it is the loud slap when it closes after the pet goes through. I'm used to flexible doors that are more quiet than this solid plastic one The solid plastic door makes it easier to clean than the quieter floppy rubber ones.
customer_reviews.author: J. Carter

customer_reviews.title: I like the door
customer_reviews.text: I did not install it, so I do not know how difficult it is to install. My only issue, and it is not a big one, is that the magnet is a little big and so the cat really has to learn to push to get in and out. But, that may really be a good thing, as I have a cat that I don't want going out, and she doesn't have a lot of incentive, so that magnet may be what is stopping her. The cat who is the reason for the door - we had no choice but to let this cat out - she will push her way through it!!!
customer_reviews.author: LARCPA

customer_reviews.title: Locking mechanisms are 100% useless
customer_reviews.text: Works as a two way door for cats to come and go from room. Locking feature is 1000% junk. Cats just bust through it and practically pop the entire flap out of my door. I had this professionally installed. It was done correctly and looks clean. But the locking features are worthless. So dont plan on locking them in or out of a room. Its actually made things worse because I cant do that at all anymore. Ugh. Im surprised its got such great reviews. Maybe they are fake who knows.
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: After installed
customer_reviews.text: It has been working since I installed it. I had to removed to door to install the cat door. Good quality and fair installation instructions. The cat got the hang of it so we can keep the door closed all the time now. Sometimes we use the locks to trap her for a bath instead of hunting all over the house to find her.
customer_reviews.author: Audiomook

customer_reviews.title: Bubba likes it
customer_reviews.text: Or more accurately, the cat loves it. Mounted in a metal clad five panel door to the sun room. Fairly easy because the metal was thin. Cutting the foam core was more work. I was a little concerned that this door would not sit flat on a five panel door, and it doesn't, but the gaps are not too evident. Who gets down on the floor to check these out anyway? Our 16 pound cat goes in and out fine, if a little cautiously.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Steffey

customer_reviews.title: This cat door is awesome. I rescued a one year old cat from ...
customer_reviews.text: This cat door is awesome. I rescued a one year old cat from our local animal shelter and had the cat door installed (by a handy neighbor) into a six panel steel insulated door from our laundry room into our garage where the cat litter tray is located. We taped the door wide open for a week or so, then slowly kept lowering it for the next couple weeks. We then coaxed her through the closed door with special treats a couple times and, voila, she's been using it ever since. It's quiet and it's nice that she can see through it. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mich

customer_reviews.title: Great compromise
customer_reviews.text: For my 13+ lb cats this door was just large enough for them to comfortable go through. Down side was that it took awhile for my one cat to use not his paw first (which got caught of course) From the other cat he caught on and Started going head first. Now it’s not a problem for both of them. I had to stay home at first till my second cat caught on.
customer_reviews.author: jane

customer_reviews.title: Perfect small door for large cats
customer_reviews.text: I needed a cat door small enough to fit under the window of a storm door and leave enough room above the bottom of the door. It also needed to be large enough for an adult cat. This was just right. It installed easily and was adjustable where needed (thickness of door). I don't use the locks so I can't comment on that.
customer_reviews.author: Upstate Judith

customer_reviews.title: One Big, Happy Kitty
customer_reviews.text: Love it! So does my cat. We keep kitty's food on top of the dryer, in the basement, so our large, obnoxious Golden Retriever can't raid his bowl. Fluffy inevitably would wake us up at about 4am every morning to let him out the kitchen door to the basement (we keep it closed when the weather gets cold). No more - problem solved. Nice size for a LARGE cat (his name really isn't Fluffy but it sure does fit). He is about a 17 pound cat with a fair sized belly, and lots and lots of fur. He gets through just fine. No more early wake-up calls. Fluffy is happy, we are happy. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: C. Stanley

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY AN OFF BRAND ! THIS BRAND SEALS WELL AND KEEPS OUT WIND AND BUGS
customer_reviews.text: THIS BRAND SEALS WELL AND KEEPS OUT THE WIND AND THE BUGS !! cats take a while to learn the door so be very patient. Think carefully aboutr how far off the ground you install it because your cat has to step over the bottom to get to the other side. Another seller substituted without my permission an off brand of this type of door. The pieces didn't fit together well so it didn't seal. The cold air came streaming in as well as it was cracked large enough to let bugs crawl in.
customer_reviews.author: Stargazer Lily

customer_reviews.title: Good luck.
customer_reviews.text: The installation and the door Itself are fine. The magnets for the frame and the door are built into each piece. So you can’t remove them without tearing apart the frame. Which is what I ended up doing. There’s no training manual on how to train a cat on how this thing works and the magnet makes it too difficult for them to push it open with their little heads. Do yourself a favor and remove the bottom magnet. The door still closes and it isn’t hard for them. Will take some treats and showing them through it for a couple weeks before they figure it out. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: MY CAT LOVES HIS DOOR
customer_reviews.text: Installation is very easy if you have the right tools (drill and a jigsaw). It looks professional and the locks work well, although we don't use them. I installed the cat door on an interior door to a mechanical room that we keep our cat's food and litter box in. It took about 3 days for our cat to get familiar with the door and learn how to use it. Now he loves having a safe space to run too whenever he hears the doorbell ring.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Perez

customer_reviews.title: It's fine, I have a small cat(adult)and she is learning ...
customer_reviews.text: It's fine, I have a small cat(adult)and she is learning to use it. But I think it should be a bit bigger for a normal sized one, just because they have to crouch down to get thru and dislike the door coming down on them when they are halfway thru. But it will be fine - just a matter of (the cat) getting used to it...it doesn't inhibit her at all .probably it's just the feeling of the door on her back as she passes thru makes her pause. If I had thought of that I would probably have gotten a "dog-sized" door. But nothing against the door itself, works and installs as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: gregg arious

customer_reviews.title: The magnet is a nice touch to help the door stay closed
customer_reviews.text: Well made, clean design. The magnet is a nice touch to help the door stay closed, but my cat still hasn't figured out he can push it open himself. I'll try to remove the magnet for training. I have a multi-window door and replaced one of the insulated glass panels with 1/4" thick plywood, which I then put the cat door within - works perfect. The only drawback is the interior connection ring is set for a specific depth, so if you're going to a thinner depth like me, you'll need to cut down the plastic. This can be quite difficult without the proper tools - I used a tablesaw, which was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Regenbogen

customer_reviews.title: Door can accidentally lock due to heavy traffic
customer_reviews.text: CAUTION! One of our cats flies through this door. With 4 cats using it, the door accidentally gets locked due to the traffic. I don't always realize this and now it seems the speedy cat has seriously injured his right front leg from crashing into a locked door!
customer_reviews.author: Jambo

customer_reviews.title: Works well and was easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This door was easy to install and works well. I think it was designed to go on a flat surface, and unfortunately the door I put it on has insets so there are some funny gaps, but that is not the fault of the cat door. I have a house full of cats, and was just invaded by a big dog that I have inherited... I needed some way for the kitties to get to their litter boxes without the dog getting in there.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Where one door opens, another closes.
customer_reviews.text: This door is very satisfactory for my two felines. They became even more arrogant and entitled once they realized this door was exclusively for them; hooray for us.
customer_reviews.author: SirStraw

customer_reviews.title: Too hard for cats to use.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our new house. Our cats were used to a PetSafe brand door with a soft flap but we bought this one because of the locks. The door is too hard for the cats to open and it swings cloesd too quickly. The cats don't like it because it catches their tails.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Brodeur

customer_reviews.title: Dogs can get locked outside accidentally
customer_reviews.text: Have used this model since 2003 for our mini Dachshunds. Just bought another to replace one we bought in Aug 2014. We continue using this model because the hole in our door was cut to fit it. While it works, it’s great. But after a few years, the magnet comes out, so it doesn’t close securely. Sometimes the plastic sliding locks break off. Also, my dogs sometimes bump the sliding lock and accidentally lock themselves outside. This could be dangerous on hot days when no one is home. We tape the sliders in open position for safety.
customer_reviews.author: RD Powell

customer_reviews.title: Great door. May take some cat training.
customer_reviews.text: Great pet door! Take your time with the jigsaw and you’ll be fine. Opens/locks really well. The magnets in the unit keep it closed but able to be opened by the cats. My cats haven’t figured it out yet so I use a piece of tape to keep it open. What can you say... they’re cats! Great door though!
customer_reviews.author: Peter H.

customer_reviews.title: our cats love it - we have two mainecoon cats
customer_reviews.text: our cats love it - we have two mainecoon cats, a large breed of cats. female 20 lb (stocky and overweight) the male also 20 lb but long and much bigger then the female. Cat door works great. Cats loved it on the first day. and it fits perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Elmar

customer_reviews.title: Slight difference in this model.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Catmate door of this size that I have bought over many years, the cats tend to destroy them eventually. This one is a little different in that it sticks open a bit if the cat goes through the door slowly. I fixed it somewhat by taking out the flap and enlarging the top of the holes that the flap fits into, seems like there is a slight flaw there the holes are not big enough compared to the old door that I replaced. Also the locking tabs are now one on each side, one red and one green unlike the photo that shows the old style four tabs, red and green on both sides.
customer_reviews.author: Vegan Biker

customer_reviews.title: This door is the cat’s meow!
customer_reviews.text: I had to have someone assist me with the installation because I did not have the tools to cut through our exterior aluminum door. He needed to modify the cat door as noted in the instructions so it would work with our thin door. Once installed our cat began using it immediately with no coaxing. We keep the door propped open so that the cat does not have to push it open. We really like it and are happy that we purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Our cats 🐈 love it and so do the humans
customer_reviews.text: Our cats 🐈 love it and so do the humans! 😊 We have indoor/out door cats. Took a couple tries for them to get used to it. We just shoved them trough it a couple times and used treats. We have ours installed on an inside door leading to our gargae. We purchased a smaller one to install into our garage door. Would definitely recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: elocin

customer_reviews.title: Nice size door, for fat cats!
customer_reviews.text: It's good quality and big, which matters considering how fat one of may cats is. However, the magnet is strong, and the cats have yet to get use to it. Good for an outside door I guess. But I am going to try to remove one. Also, my last door had the option of taking the door out by unscrewing and opening the door, so it can be always open. Which is useful for an inside door, or while they are getting use to a door.
customer_reviews.author: Newmacgirl

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Happy with it .Does the job. One good thing about it is that the door is clear. Not all are. Another one in front of house is not clear and cats will not use it. Person who installed it did something wrong and had to take apart and do again. Better to be more careful and do once.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Needs weaker magnet
customer_reviews.text: Pretty well made but the magnet is super strong My cats can’t push it open and it closes on their tail may need to remove the bottom magnet with a razor blade it also does make a loud thump when closing and the magnet catches but for an exterior door this would be great
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: NOT LARGE
customer_reviews.text: NOT a large cat door, this is dinky, acting like big dogs could get through is ridiculous. I can't imagine what a small size would be like, you would probably be lucky to get a guinea pig through that. My small dogs struggle to get through, my cats make it through fine but this is not a Large door.
customer_reviews.author: Tally

customer_reviews.title: Great Seller read review
customer_reviews.text: Great product. This is our 2nd one. Nothing is really wrong per say with the prior one (exact by Amazon). With as many kids (felines) we have it is just worse out from normal use. I have one small break after years that does not really interfere with in and out. Just time to replace. It has served us well and owes us nothing. The cat door did it's job well with great durability.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Installation was easy, the instructions were clear
customer_reviews.text: This works fantastically. Installation was easy, the instructions were clear, and it looks good installed. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that the switches are a little too easy to flip, so my cats occasionally lock themselves in or out trying to paw the flap open. This is only a problem on especially hot days or especially rainy days, when my elderly cat gets stuck outside.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: very durable
customer_reviews.text: Just replaced my original door of 12 yrs. They do take a beating, couldn't get it clean any more, still functioned well had one broken lock on it. Highly recommend this door for a larger cat. Can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: BURK

customer_reviews.title: Lock broke quickly. Cats paw got stuck in door.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my “cat room” to keep the dogs away from litter boxes. I locked the cat’s in the room once to leave my doors and windows open in the house after painting.. the cats broke the green lock at the bottom, got his paw stuck and we ended up at the vets office. Don’t recommend buying if you have cats that don’t like being locked in a room for more than 3 hrs
customer_reviews.author: bwalters

customer_reviews.title: Broke after several months
customer_reviews.text: One of the closure tabs broke after 6 months. The cost with shipping to replace a single tab is 1/2 the cost of a new cat door!!
customer_reviews.author: Philippe G.

customer_reviews.title: PSA! DO NOT use their instructions for screw hole pilot drill size!
customer_reviews.text: The instructions contain a critical flaw and other reviews mention this: The drill bit size they recommend (3/16") is far too large for the screws and will subsequently ruin your project. Luckily I caught the mistake and then spent 30 minutes reading reviews to make sure I wasn't crazy. In the end my door installed nicely and even though it was a cheap hollow core door it is firmly attached. TBD on whether the cats will use it... I haven't had the chance to train them yet.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: My fat cats love it
customer_reviews.text: We used this for our door leading into the garage so the cats could use the litter there. We were nervous because our doors are not flushed they have decorative groves, however it went on great we didn’t even have to use sealant or anything like that.
customer_reviews.author: Vaaal31

customer_reviews.title: Works smoothly for my speed demon!
customer_reviews.text: This door "seemed" smaller than the one we use for another door in our house, but it's perfect. We have a very lively little girl that just flies in and out of this cat door without hesitation. I opens into a Catio, where she spends a lot of time.
customer_reviews.author: Rita V. Houghton

customer_reviews.title: A excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent door for larger cats. Very easy to install with the pattern included in package. This one is definitely better than the one that we replaced it with. I highly recommend this product to anyone looking to purchase one for their bigger cat or smaller dog. 1/2 the price of the one it replaced and it works much better and seals better ( I have it installed in an exterior door). I also like the clear door we can see when a raccoon is trying to get in.
customer_reviews.author: John Q

customer_reviews.title: I'm very pleased
customer_reviews.text: This door does the trick and is much cheaper than alternatives.It was easy to install for this novice and seems pretty foolproof. The fit is good without wind leaks, the cat figured it out fast, and it seems like a very reasonable amount of pressure is required to open. The locking mechanisms work. All in all, I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: LD Crowe

customer_reviews.title: Its a door for your cat.
customer_reviews.text: Its a door you cat can go through. Works fine so far. Some cat training is necessary to get the cat to understand they can safely go theough this door, and that they need to push hard. Some people are complaining about the magnets being too strong. You need to train the cat it can open the flap by pushing it harder, or you can use a drill to take the magnets out.
customer_reviews.author: Gerard

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit standard US interior door
customer_reviews.text: The screws that came with it where too short. I had to geht my own 2”long screws to install it on a standard US interior door. Magnet too strong for my kitten to open it. Magnet can’t be taken out. Also the flap can not be removed so the cat gets used to it first without the flap. Go buy a different one
customer_reviews.author: Ralle

customer_reviews.title: Quality for my money
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful item to allow our cats to come and go as they please to the screened in porch. I just have to figure out how to put it in since it is going into the metal storm door. Because of the gap in the product I will have to measure and build a wooden frame around it.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Cats were afraid to use the door
customer_reviews.text: Installed this on a cabinet that I had turned into a litter box enclosure. Door swung back and forth without issue when I pushed on it. However, both of my cats were afraid to use the door for whatever reason. I tried to train them to use the door with treats and toys but nothing ever worked. I ended up selling the enclosure to someone else with a cat. Hopefully they’re not having the same issues.
customer_reviews.author: CRT

customer_reviews.title: Magnet Too Strong. Cat Has A Hard Time Opening.
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a good idea, but my cat is kinda afraid of this. The main reason I gave this 2 stars is because of the magnet in the flap. My cat has a tough time pushing the door open. He will bat at it for about 10 minutes before getting through it. after listening to that for 5 minutes, I end up opening the door for the cat.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff T

customer_reviews.title: Good but heavy.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good door, works as promised. The only problem with it is the magnet is REALLY strong, so my cat is too afraid to use it. I have been taping it up so that she will get used to the hole first. Haven't gotten her to go through it with the flap down. Also, it is VERY big. Think small dog door.
customer_reviews.author: Katya Belikova

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: We have had one of these installed for 16 years, and it's still working. We figure that, at some point, we'll have to replace something, and we wanted to have the same product on hand. I highly recommend this cat door. (It is sized for larger cats, like Maine Coons.)
customer_reviews.author: P. McKinney

customer_reviews.title: Work exactly as I needed it.
customer_reviews.text: Used this door to build a cat access in the window of my home. It has taken weeks for my cats to push past the magnet holding the flap shut. They are used to the main dog door two flap system. This worked very well and, despite temperatures falling below zero, kept the cold out of the bedroom. I especially like the fact that my big 18# cat has no problem sliding in and out of this cat door.
customer_reviews.author: 1gypsy

customer_reviews.title: Really bad instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how this product has such great reviews. Instructions it comes with are laughable in how bad they are. Also used the drill bit size 3/16 but the holes are too big for the screws so now I have a giant hole with a cat door that that will not screw in. Not sure how i am going to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Mamling

customer_reviews.title: Great, if your cat isn't too smart to let themselves in or out by bypassing the lock
customer_reviews.text: One of our two cats figured out how to go out from the inside when the door is set to in only (one way). Thus we have to lock the door completely to keep him inside instead of putting him outside, then he puts himself back inside one time. The locking system is a bit confusing even with the two colored latches. Maybe a label you could attach that would indicate what the locks mean would help. I have to usually push the door to confirm my selection.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should. Easy install
customer_reviews.text: Works just as it should. My cat caught on quick. I think he really likes it as he can go in the laundry room to eat and get away from the dogs! Now, I'm just wondering how long it takes the dog to figure out how to use it
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: has been easy to clean and still works as new
customer_reviews.text: I have installed two of these in my house. One has been in use for 33 years now, has been easy to clean and still works as new. The other is new. The old one is set to allow One Way Traffic only. When I have gatherings or parties, I can sequester the cats in the back part of the house - where their litter pan resides behind door number two! It helps with control odor and scattered litter. This is good!
customer_reviews.author: MPL SYRP

customer_reviews.title: Purrfect!
customer_reviews.text: Love this door! It's very transparent and kittehs couldn't figure out for a bit how to transition- you can see all the way through the door. I have one 18 kitty that has lost fur on other doors, not this one. Will be the only door I will reorder.
customer_reviews.author: Britton

customer_reviews.title: Efficient pet door
customer_reviews.text: This door is efficient for very small dogs or medium cats. Its easy to install, locks in multiple in/out positions and is unobtrusive. Too small for home burglars to use. Provides a good airlock also, unlike our flap type door.
customer_reviews.author: Chelle

customer_reviews.title: The quality has stood up just fine and continues to hold up as of this review
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for several months now and it works perfectly. My cat learned to use it within a few days with a little encouragement. Now my kitty goes in and out as he pleases and uses regularly. Depending on the exterior door you put it in, my husband was able to make the prop cut in the wood door and attach the cat door without any problems. The quality has stood up just fine and continues to hold up as of this review. No need for a more expensive one I don’t think. This door works great and I would definitely buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie, NY

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves the freedom to come and go
customer_reviews.text: I love this. It’s one of the best things I’ve ever bought. My rescue cat is an outdoor/indoor feline who loves the freedom to come and go as he pleases. It makes both of our lives easier and happier because I don’t have to get up and open the door for him to come or go out. Trust me, he puts up a fuss, lol.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Bennett

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it
customer_reviews.text: Good door, I love the four way lock function. If you have the right tools and know how to use them the installation is not difficult. Took about a day for my female cat to get used to it, but it took my male cat about ten days to be comfortable with it. Both my cats are now pros at using the door. I haven't had any issues with it. It isn't very weather proof though, the edges have a row of soft bristles as a protection from the elements so there is no seal. I don't have issues with this, as my door leads to a covered porch.
customer_reviews.author: esgee

customer_reviews.title: Works really good
customer_reviews.text: We installed on a solid core door with concave panels on both sides. Considerably more difficulty cutting than a door with flat panels. Our kitty took a while to master use due to magnet strength. Suggest a way to add magnets after the cat is comfortable with use. Otherwise all is well.
customer_reviews.author: RWS

customer_reviews.title: Locks are useless for a determined cat
customer_reviews.text: The gap around the flap seems pretty large. Large enough for same insects to get thru. The locks are useless. My cats go thru to he locked door like it's open, which is unfortunate because I really wanted to be able to control when they could go out. Otherwise it looks good, was easy enough to install in spite of the "directions."
customer_reviews.author: startnovr

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Has made my life easier. Easy install. Installed in our door between house and garage. Kitten took to it quickly, my more cautious adult took a little longer. I propped it open for a couple days and and she caught on quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Kcanbeamusing

customer_reviews.title: Great pet door
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pet door. Read the directions carefully and fully if you have a thin door. At first glance it doesn't look like it will work. The door needs to be trimmed. It's holding up well with two cats and a small dog.
customer_reviews.author: Acorn

customer_reviews.title: A little hesitant to cut a hole in the door ...
customer_reviews.text: A little hesitant to cut a hole in the door, and my cat was a little hesitant to start going through it, but this allowed us to have the litter tray in the basement without leaving the door open all the time. After a day or two, the cat really took to it and it's amazingly convenient. The only drawback is that the brushes which help to seal the edges also collect a ton of hair from the cat.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! We turned a closet in the hallway into a cat litter room and this worked great! Hubby was able to install it easily!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Keck Webb

customer_reviews.title: Just What We Wanted
customer_reviews.text: Fit the door perfectly. Didn't take much time at all to install. My cats can't seem to figure out the door flap so I removed it. The opening in the door works fine. I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Ross A. Wheatley

customer_reviews.title: If the cats are playful, they may accidentally lock themselves in or out.
customer_reviews.text: It is a little tricky for the cats to get in and out of because of the magnetic shut mechanism, however this is a great feature to have to ensure a sealed door. My two cats are at various levels of operating (one is young the other is old) Although the younger cats could have used a smaller door, she is able to manage getting in and out easier than my older cat who has difficulty. He is larger and heavier and can just lean into the door to open it which helps. I am quite sure that the cats will learn how to easily get in and out of the cat door soon.
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: As expected, frustrating install
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. Used a jigsaw to install. The screws didn't seem right. I could never get the bottoms to reach. I ended up using some screws from another project.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Installation is difficult with the wrong screws
customer_reviews.text: My handyman is still trying to get this door in after 2 hrs. There are 2 sets of screws, One set is too short for the width of the door, The other set is long enough but the heads are smaller than the holes. What a mess. I should have just returned it and bought another.
customer_reviews.author: Damon Atherly

customer_reviews.title: ... a wall (it's not quite deep enough but it's easy to fill in the gap)
customer_reviews.text: Installed it to the outside through a wall (it's not quite deep enough but it's easy to fill in the gap). The cats were hesitant at first but now they're using it every day! No more litter box! What I used to install is a oscilating cutting tool and a jigsaw.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Disturbs time/space continuum otherwise fine
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Cat's got it figured out. Feels a bit cheap but has held up half a year so far. The problem I ran into was that the door actually sticks open half an inch because of the way the magnetic fields line up if it doesn't swing down hard. This isn't a huge problem for me because it's in my basement door but if you actually had this going outside it would let in cold air.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B

customer_reviews.title: good article
customer_reviews.text: I love this door, finally I can go and let my kittens go to the garage without any problem, only that it is difficult for them to adapt and that they can push it. but it works very well, good article
customer_reviews.author: Nelson Orlando Rodriguez Oseguera

customer_reviews.title: The best cat door!
customer_reviews.text: The best cat door! Have used this door for almost 20 years in 2 different houses, and am about to have one installed in yet another home. Cats from 9 to 17 pounds have used it with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Space

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: The only issue we've had is that the dogs (Shih Tzus & Maltese) can sometimes hit the lock and end up locking themselves inside or outside.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing!!!!!! It’s the best thing I’ve ever bought for our cat!! It’s fits perfect on our garage door and our cat loves it. We needed the liter box to be in the garage and our cat has no problem coming in and out to use his liter box. We’ve had it now for about a year and it’s caused no problems at all. Overall I recommend this product so much for anyone who needs a cat door.
customer_reviews.author: April Lynn

product_meta.title: Ani Mate Cat Mate Large Cat Door, White
product_meta.description: Specially developed for the largest cats or small dogs up to a shoulder height of 14â€ (360mm). A secure, double point 4 Way locking mechanism gives complete control of your pets movement. Self lining to 2â€ (50mm) - ideal for all doors and thin panels.
feature_bullets: Brush strip to reduce energy loss and silent action

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
